main event: A glowing object was observed over the Washington and Portland, Oregon area for 15-20 seconds.
interesting points: The object moved faster than an aircraft, stopped, and restarted.
The object was at an elevation of 20-30 degrees.
The weather was dark at the time of the observation.
The description of the sighting is characteristic of a ballistic-type observation, possibly a meteor.
The brevity of the observation and lack of details precluded a definitive conclusion, so the case was listed as 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation'.
location: Washington and 30 mile area of Portland, Oregon
